intro: Godetia hansenii, commonly known as the Hansen's godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive red or purple center, typically blooming in the spring and summer. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant appearance and ease of cultivation. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique botanical characteristics.
